import React, { useState } from 'react'; const Search = () => { const [value,setValue]=useState(); const [books,setBooks]=useState(); const getInputValue=(e)=>{ setValue(e.target.value); } const fetchData=()=>{ const url = `https://openlibrary.org/search.json?q=${value}` // fetch the url fetch(url) .then(res => res.json()) .then(data => setBooks(data.docs)) } return (

F!nd Knowledge

{ books && books.map(book=> // Organizing Cards

{book.title}

{book.author_name}

Publisher: {book.publisher}

Publish Year:{book.first_publish_year}

{book.edition_count} $

{/* Details Modal Button */} {/* Details Modal */} {/* edition_count language first_sentence */}

Modal title

...
) }
); }; export default Search;
